text: Aswan International Airport , also known as Daraw Airport, is a domestic airport located southwest of Aswan, Egypt. It was built in 1956 and upgraded in 1992 and 1999 by the Egyptian government. == Destinations == Despite its name, it mainly offers flights to Cairo. There are also flights to Abu Simbel, a tourist destination farther south. == Accidents and incidents == * In October 1963, a Soviet Union military transport plane crashed at the airport, killing 14 people. * 20 March 1969, a United Arab Airlines Il-18 crashed while attempting to land at Aswan International Airport. 100 of the 105 passengers and crew on board died. == References == Category:Buildings and structures in Egypt
title: Aswan International Airport
